III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is complying will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is complying will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 The facility was completing the personal inventory for each youth, and they
had the staff who completed the document sign the document. However, it was
suggested that they also obtain the youth’s signature to verify that the youth
knows what items they have. The facility did provide one personal inventory
with a youth’s signature, and they reported, they will start this process
immediately.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The first corrective action plan was regarding their 2020 Renewal Inspection.
The second corrective action plan was regarding Special Investigation
2021C0207009 which was initiated on 2/8/2021. The allegations involved the facility
having an indoor temperature of 54 degrees and the violation involved Ruel 400.4431
Heating equipment. The facility replaced their furnace and developed a corrective
action plan. This approved CAP involved the Chief Administrator and Quality
Supervisor monitoring the temperature daily and documenting this action. There was
an additional finding involving the facility using electric space heaters which was a
violation of Rule 400.4552. The approved corrective action plan regarding this
violation involved the development of a new policy to prohibit the use of space
1

heaters and weekly monitoring by the Chief Administrator and Quality Supervisor to
ensure that these space heaters are not being used. During this inspection, the
temperature was appropriate, and the facility provided documentation to support their
monitoring of the temperature.
Interviews were conducted and involved all the youth currently in the home and
several staff members, ranging from direct care staff to the Chief Administrator. All
the youth reported feeling safe at the facility and having staff provide appropriate
supervision. They also report a belief that their needs are being met. The staff present
with a desire to engage in best practice for the youth and believe the administration is
supportive of them. Administration was very positive and reports being willing and
able to adjust to the changes that are occurring in the child welfare field.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
